resources.string: Just take a colored square and drag it to the desired part of the screen
Check the box \'Return back\' and the colored square will return to where you took it. \n \nCheck the box \'Frame hard\' and the colored square will rest against the edges of the root container.
If there is an object under the square that has a click listener, it will intercept our touch, check the \'Resolve touch conflict\' box to fix this problem
If you need to make a click on an object, the \'DragAndDrop\' action will start with a long click
Set the listener to \'DragAndDrop\' objects and you will know where the square is and who it intersects with
